children.text: There is no evidence that the exhaust fan installed in this area has been ducted through into the outside air, and appears to only ventilate into the floor/roof space.
The NCC’s Building Code of Australia (BCA) states in section 3.8.7.3 - Flow rate and discharge of exhaust systems, that
‘Exhaust from a bathroom, sanitary compartment, or laundry must be discharged;
directly or via a shaft or duct to outdoor air; or
to a roof space that is ventilated in accordance with 3.8.7.4’
Section 3.8.7.4 - Ventilation of roof spaces, states that
‘Where an exhaust system covered by 3.8.7.3 discharges into a roof space, the roof space must be ventilated to outdoor air through evenly distributed openings’ .
This fan must be confirmed as exhausting directly out to the external air or otherwise rectified to do so in accordance with the requirements of the BCA.
